items.title: New York City Council Approves Rezoning Plan for Midtown Manhattan
items.abstract: The plan, which is meant to revive what was once the core of corporate activity in the city, is likely to make the area more densely packed while yielding upgrades to subway stations and public spaces.

items.title: City Council Approves Inwood Rezoning, Despite Resident Protests
items.abstract: Inwood will be the fifth neighborhood to be rezoned under Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has pledged to use zoning laws to increase affordable housing.

items.title: Rezoning Plan for Manhattan Elementary School Draws Anger From All Sides
items.abstract: New York City is trying to change school zone lines on the Upper West Side, but after countless meetings addressing the proposals, a consensus has not been reached.

items.title: City to Settle Discrimination Claim in Brooklyn Housing Plan
items.abstract: An eight-year legal fight over racial discrimination in a proposed development plan for the Broadway Triangle ends with the city agreeing to changes.
